a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Threshold income for each decile (before tax), United States
The level of income per year below which 10%, 20%, 30%, etc. of the population falls. Income here is measured
Note: This data is measured in international-$ at 2023 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between
countries. Income is measured before payment of taxes and non-pension benefits, but after the payment of public and private pensions.
